concept.title: Command Settings
concept.shortdesc: Settings are key/value pairs. Commands that accept settings use an settings block, delimited by square brackets, which comes after the command. A settings block can can accept one or more settings, separated by a comma.

example.p: Commands that accept settings can have an settings block with just a single option.
Commands that accept settings can have an settings block with multiple options separated by a comma.

link.desc: Commands can accept parameters. Collections of parameters that change the behavior of the command are setups. Setups come after the command in blocks, delimited into blocks by square brackets.
